snippet: Several economists think much of the investing world has overestimated how hard the markets and investors would be hit if tax rates on dividends and capital gains rise at the end of the year, as the White House has proposed.
abstract: Several economists think much of the investing world has overestimated how hard the markets and investors would be hit if tax rates on dividends and capital gains rise at the end of the year, as the White House has proposed.
lead_paragraph: Several economists think much of the investing world has overestimated how hard the markets and investors would be hit if tax rates on dividends and capital gains rise at the end of the year, as the White House has proposed. Analysts who have studied past changes in tax rates found that the shifts had less of an effect on investor behavior than was initially expected, Nathaniel Popper reports in The New York Times. Read more »

headline.main: Some Analysts Doubt Dire Predictions on Tax Increase Fallout
